CN.content:

Paragraph: Increase in electron - donating strength of the counit leads to upshift in both HOMO and LUMO , while increase in electron - withdrawing strength of the counit leads to downshift in both HOMO and LUMO.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| electron-donating counit |
| electron-withdrawing counit |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Increase in electron - donating strength of the counit leads to upshift in both HOMO and LUMO , while increase in electron - withdrawing strength of the counit leads to downshift in both HOMO and LUMO.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| ------------ |
| electron-donating strength of the counterion |
| electron-withdrawing strength of the counterion |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| ------------ |
| electron-donating strength of the counterion |
| electron-withdrawing strength of the counterion |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |

These entities are material properties as they describe characteristics of the counterion and its effect on the molecular orbitals of the material.

Paragraph: Increase in electron - donating strength of the counit leads to upshift in both HOMO and LUMO , while increase in electron - withdrawing strength of the counit leads to downshift in both HOMO and LUMO.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| electron - donating strength of the counter ion |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Note: In this context, the "strength" refers to the ability of a substance to donate or withdraw electrons, which can be considered a material property.
